item.title: James Howard Kunstler: The tragedy of suburbia
item.dc:creator: Brian Kirsten
item.content:encoded: From the Ted talks series, James Howard Kunstler talks about suburban sprawl and the loss of urban design. It's a longish video (21+ minutes) but still worth watching. My favorite quote: "If you stand at the apron of the Walmart over here and try to look at the Target over here, you can't see it because of the curvature of the Earth."
